Prerequisites: ACG 2071 WITH GRADE OF "C" OR BETTER AND SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE ON PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING COMPETENCY EXAM
Corequisites: FIN 3403 WITH GRADE OF "C" OR BETTER
Course Description: AN OVERVIEW OF FINANCIAL REPORTING AND PRACTICE IN THE UNITED STATES AND INTERNATIONALLY WITH A FOCUS ON HOW MANAGEMENT DECISIONS IMPACT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE END OF THE COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL:

1. DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF THE DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING ENVIRONMENT;
2. ANALYZE THE EFFECTS OF ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS ON THE ACCOUNTING EQUATION AND IDENTIFY PERMANENT VERSUS TEMPORARY ACCOUNTS; AND
3. DESCRIBE THE PURPOSE AND LIMITATIONS OF THE BALANCE SHEET.
Textbook(s): SPICELAND, NELSON, & THOMAS. (2017). INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING (10TH ED.). IRWIN/MCGRAW-HILL
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
